summary.para: Deprecated. Gets connection points for browser events.

param.name: riid
param.para: Type: REFIID
The IID of the interface on the connection point container whose connection point object is being requested. One of the following values.
Value that indicates a member of the DWebBrowserEvents interface.
Value that indicates a member of the DWebBrowserEvents2 interface.
Value that indicates a member of the interface.

param.name: ppccp
param.para: Type: CIE4ConnectionPoint**
The address of a pointer to the browser connection point.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: IExpDispSupport.FindCIE4ConnectionPoint was created specifically for use with Windows Internet Explorer 4.0.

param.name: dispidMember
param.para: Type: DISPID
A dispatch ID that identifies the member being invoked.

param.name: iid
param.para: Type: REFIID
Reserved. Must be IID_NULL.

param.name: lcid
param.para: Type: LCID
A locale ID providing a locale context in which to interpret arguments. Applications that do not support multiple languages can ignore this parameter.

param.name: wFlags
param.para: Type: WORD
Flags describing the context of the call, including the following.

The member is invoked as a method. If a property has the same name, both this and the DISPATCH_PROPERTYGET flag may be set. The member is invoked as a method. If a property has the same name, both this and the DISPATCH_PROPERTYGET flag may be set.
The member is retrieved as a property or data member.
The member is changed as a property or data member.
The member is changed by a reference assignment, rather than a value assignment. This flag is valid only when the property accepts a reference to an object.

param.name: pdispparams
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to a structure containing an array of arguments, an array of argument DISPIDs for named arguments, and counts for the number of elements in the arrays.

param.name: pVarResult
param.para: Type: VARIANT*
A pointer to the location where the result is to be stored, or NULL if the caller expects no result. This argument is ignored if DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUT or DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUTREF is specified.

param.name: pexcepinfo
param.para: Type: EXCEPINFO*
A pointer to a structure that contains exception information. This structure should be filled in if DISP_E_EXCEPTION is returned. Can be NULL.

param.name: puArgErr
param.para: Type: UINT*

The index within the rgvarg member of the structure of the first argument that has an error. Arguments are stored in rgvarg in reverse order, so the first argument is the one with the highest index in the array. This parameter is returned only when the resulting return value is DISP_E_TYPEMISMATCH or DISP_E_PARAMNOTFOUND. This argument can be set to NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Deprecated. Instructs the control site to process the keystroke described in pMsg and modified by the flags in grfModifiers.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to an structure that describes the keystroke to be processed.

param.name: grfModifiers
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags describing the state of the CTRL, ALT, and SHIFT keys. The value of the flags can be any valid KEYMODIFIERS enumeration value or values.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the container processed the message, S_FALSE if the container did not process the message, or E_NOTIMPL if the container does not implement accelerator support.

summary.para: Deprecated. Exposes methods that allow the retrieval of properties, translation of keyboard accelerators, and determination of a connection point for certain events.

remarks.para: Note IExpDispSupport might not be supported in versions of Windows later than Windows XP.
